Description of incident: The College of the Desert in Palm Dale Calfornia informed individuals of a data breach in their system when a college employee sent an unauthorized attachment in an email to approximately 78 college employees,  that contained personal information of employees of the college. The information contained in the attachment included names, Social Security numbers, dates of birth, geners, zip codes, titles of postions held at the university, employment anniversary date, employee identification numbers, insurance information,  active or retired employee status.Those who are affected are asked to call Stan Dupree, HR and Labor Relations Director at 760-674-3777760-674-3777or sdupree@collegeofthedesert.eduUPDATE (6/19/2014): According to new reports, The College of the Desert breach affected 1,900 current and former employees. The total individuals affected was not reported when the breach was made public.CallSend SMSAdd to SkypeYou'll need Skype CreditFree via Skype
